posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked:
Wanted to know if it was possible to characterize torque-based velocity ( FOC ) with sysId and if so how to go about it and if not how best to characterize.  Following CTRE ’s examples for Velocity based control here

would lend me to believe that it is a whole different thing entirely, but wanted to check.

posts.name: gcschmit
posts.cooked: SysID with CTRE swerve characterization Programming

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: Excellent.  Could I then creat a dcmotorsim using the kv ka values and pump in current as the input instead of voltage?

posts.name: Eli Barnett

posts.custom_user_title: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: How would I then use kS, kV, kA, etc in a DCMotorSim model?  Or would sysId only be valuable in determining KP and KD for CTRE velocity contol?

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked:
narmstro:

How would I then use kS, kV, kA, etc in a DCMotorSim model?

If you measure these in terms of current, you cannot.
